sentences.en: a brief interlude of peace before a return to the battlefield
sentences.cn: 重返战场之前的短暂平静

sentences.en: Dance should not be just an interlude between songs but should be self - suffi - cient.
sentences.cn: 舞蹈不应只是歌曲间的穿插表演而应成为独立的艺术形式.

sentences.en: Fallout - Another interlude, but this one I liked.
sentences.cn: 原子尘埃-又一首过场, 但我喜欢这段.

sentences.en: Her time in Paris was a happy interlude in a difficult career.
sentences.cn: 她在巴黎期间是她艰辛的事业中一段愉快的插曲.

sentences.en: However, under the luxurious treatment also presented a point small interlude.
sentences.cn: 不过, 豪华待遇下也出现了一点小插曲.

sentences.en: It was a happy interlude in the Kents' life.
sentences.cn: 那是肯特一家的生活中一段幸福的插曲。

sentences.en: It was only an interlude of a few months.
sentences.cn: 那件事也只是几个月的生活片段.

sentences.en: Kerensky has a place in history, of a brief interlude between despotisms ( William Safire )
sentences.cn: 克伦斯基为专制统治时期的小插曲在历史上占有一席之地 ( 威廉萨菲尔 )

sentences.en: Penalization is essential if peace is a feverish interlude between wars.
sentences.cn: 倘若和平不应当仅仅是两次战争之间狂热的插曲,那么处罚措施是必不可少的.

sentences.en: Penalization is essential if peace is to be more than a feverish interlude between wars.
sentences.cn: 倘若和平不应当仅仅是两次战争之间狂热的插曲,那麽处罚措施是必不可少的.

sentences.en: Since that film scores a great success, its interlude songs are also much sought after.
sentences.cn: 4由于那部电影大获成功, 它的插曲也很受欢迎.

sentences.en: Still, the occupants were not killed, and, after a brief interlude, resumed their fire.
sentences.cn: 尽管如此, 防御者仍未被杀死, 而且在简短的间歇后又恢复了射击.

sentences.en: The following four years were a prosperous interlude.
sentences.cn: 随后四年,是繁荣的间歇期.

sentences.en: There will now be a 15 - minute interlude.
sentences.cn: 现在有15分钟的中间休息.

sentences.en: This carefree interlude reacted upon the young people like wine.
sentences.cn: 这一段轻松的插曲令年轻人陶醉.

trans.tran_cn: 插曲，穿插，幕间节目，[乐]间奏
trans.tran_en: a period of time between two events or situations, during which something different happens
